```julia> using NelderMead

julia> function rosenbrocknd(x)
         ithterm(i) = (1 - x[i])^2 + 100 * (x[i+1] - x[i]^2)^2
         return mapreduce(ithterm, +, 1:length(x)-1)
       end

text:
My problem was hanging in Optim.jl and I couldn’t figure it out. I wanted to learn more about it so wrote my own, which ended up being neater (imo) than that in Optim.jl largely because Optim.jl has to fit all the algos under one API.

Also, in the end I wrote <https://github.com/jwscook/WindingNelderMead.jl> which bought me about a factor of 10 speed up because my problem is 1) very expensive, 2) complex valued and 3) has minima at zero.
